ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Take this course if you like language. Everything you read is in Old English, and there is a lot of grammar rules, etc. so it really is more like a language course than a literature course.

It's an introductory course to Old English. I would highly recommend it to a student who is interested in Old English, but I might not recommend it to someone who is just looking to fulfill a language requirement.

The course conveniently covered both the ancient language and ancient literature requirements for my program; I would not recommend it for other reasons. Perhaps if the teaching had been more rigorous, I could have felt better satisfied.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I took this course for the sole purpose of meeting the ancient period/language requirements of my program. It did not contribute in any way to my future research. I would much rather have taken something that matched my interests.
